content: I think Google's Pixel Buds A-Series are the best earbuds yet because they are so cheap.
The Google Pixel Buds 2a added ANC but brought with it a higher price tag.
The Google Pixel Buds 2a are better with ANC due to being affordable earbuds.
The Pixel Buds A-Series adds extra value to their purchase in my opinion.
I've been waiting for Gemini Live in the Pixel Buds Pro 2 for so long.
I'll throw in a pair of Pixel Buds because why not, they are great.
The Pixel Buds Pro 2 is a huge new update from Google, pretty amazing.
They offer excellent sound quality and are easy to use, really great.
Patiently waiting for my pixel to arrive, I would return these buds.
I have selected pixel buds 2020 setting that gives a great audio output.
I think the Nuraphones have good sound by the reviews, but they're not noise cancelling.
Pixel Buds A-Series is cheerful in its execution, making it enjoyable to use.
The earpieces are larger than the Google Pixel Buds A-series, which may affect comfort.
Pixel Buds A-Series is cheerful in its execution, offering a positive user experience.
The Google Pixel Buds A-Series has a unique design with lightweight earbuds.
Pixel Buds A-Series is cheerful in its execution, providing a pleasant experience.
I'm curious if anyone can hear what I'm listening to while wearing them.
Stems are overlooked on wireless earbuds. I wish my Galaxy Buds had them.
I think these earbuds will only last three months. Google won't help with repairs.
Do these leak sound? I returned my Pixel Buds because they leaked too much.
I just got mine and I miss the ear wings because they aren't secure.
I have low volume for phone calls. The media sounds loud, anyone else have that?
I wish I could use the case magnets to secure it. Otherwise, I am enjoying the Pros.
I can't get a good fit. My ears are too small, I might return them.
The Ars Technica review left out the cons. ANC isn't good and audio quality lacks.
I can't wear them because Google ditched the wings. My A-series stay in well.
The large tips passed the fit test, but they loosen on the bike. Need better tips.
Call quality is just ok, not great. Curious to hear more about that from users.
I love my Airpod pros. I never have issues with them, unlike these earbuds.
I am waiting for them to go on sale around Christmas time.
I find the ear tips hurt. The sound is muddy. The A series sound better.
I had to switch to the smallest tip. They feel like they aren't secure.
These are garbage because they come loose constantly and the touch function sucks.
I was planning to buy this and will absolutely will buy this, I don't like base.
The downsides outweigh the advantages, especially longevity. I won't buy them again.
They are significantly more comfortable than the silicone tips, which is a game changer!
I agree mostly. I could not get them to fit properly with the silicone tips.
ANC does not work for me. There is no difference when it's turned on.
I avoid earbuds with a stem. They look ridiculous and I hate them.
My pixel buds have a good connection. Sound is clear, but a little quiet.
They're comfortable but not loud enough. If your volume slider is below 50%, they're inaudible.
They were a pleasant surprise, better than my work Air Pods. Great sound.
They are fantastic with my 2XL. No disconnection issues, and extremely comfortable.
They work great, and have good volume and sound for my ears. Great upgrade.
Super quiet and slow to connect lol, but connected to my Pixel 6 Pro and 100000x better.
They're literally Google airpods, with decent audio and durability, and connectivity issues.
They hurt after a while. AirPods Pros are much more comfortable for me.
The Bluetooth range is superior to Samsung's buds, which constantly disconnect in my pocket.
I enjoy mine and find that I can rest comfortably with them in at night.
They sound fantastic and fit comfortably. Amazing, like a Home mini in my ear.
I love mine. The only issue I have is the color options which aren't great.
I love them (using with a Pixel 4a). They just work well and simply.
I use mine at the gym and they're great. The call quality seems good too.
They seem to let in a lot of noise and don't get a good seal in my ears.
Buds pro tend to fall out, but the audio quality is great, but a series stays in.
The pixel bud don't stay in my ears. I use a pair of cheap first gen airpods.
My A series buds stay in much better for me when out jogging because of the wings.
The pressure inside the ear canal on both buds? And how is long term comfort?
How in the world can they launch these with the same static hissing noise?
